Each Adrenaline Point adds $I$% to the chance of killing an opponent instantly. Does not apply to Whirl.

Strong attack that goes through blocks, armor and shields. Increases weapon damage by $S$% per each Stamina point spent and by $S$% per each Adrenaline Point ($S$% max). Increases critical hit chance by $S$%.

Spinning attack that strikes all foes in the surrounding area. Grants $S$% Attack Power per additional attacker (max. $S$%). Maintaining the attack consumes $S$ Stamina per second. If available, adrenaline point is used to decrease the damage received during the attack by $S$%.

Spinning attack that strikes all foes in the surrounding area. Grants $S$% Attack Power per additional attacker (max. $S$%). Maintaining the attack consumes $S$ Stamina per second. If available, adrenaline point is used to decrease the damage received during the attack by $S$%.
Adrenaline Gain

Damage dealt with Fast attacks charges your Strong attack with additional power: +$S$% to Attack Power for each piece of the set (currently +$S$%), up to +$S$% max. And vice versa. The bonus is reset after performing a charged attack and at the end of the combat.
Casting a sign reduces stamina cost of all the subsequent actions taken by $S$% for each piece of the set. Current bonus: $S$%. Lasts for $S$ sec.
The size of Yrden traps is increased by $S$%. While you are within an Yrden trap, Sign Intensity is increased by $S$% and damage resistance is increased by $S$%.

Crossbow critical hit chance is increased by $S$% and critical hit power - by $S$%. Crossbow bolts pierce and knock down or stun opponents. Opponents struck when they have full Vitality lose $S$% of Vitality.

When Vitality reaches zero, Adrenaline Points will be consumed to prevent death and grant invulnerability and increased Vitality regeneration for $S$s. Restores $S$% of Vitality per Adrenaline Point (max $S$%). Cannot be triggered more than once every $S$s.

An active shield that absorbs up to 100% of damage dealt by enemy's weapon. Base damage absorption is $I$% bigger. Maintaining it drains $I$ Stamina Points per second. Wolf School defensive techniques: parry, counter, dodge. Successful countering grants additional $I$% chance to critical hit. Parry and counter success depends on attack and enemy type: partial parry reduces damage taken by $I$% and prevents bleeding, partial counter additionally prevents all negative effects and allows to deal damage in return. Successful parry/counter reduces damage taken to zero. Rolling allows to dodge arrows and to avoid knockdown and stagger effects. Dodge success depends on attack type, attacker distance and dodge direction (angle distance). Partially successful dodge reduces damage taken just partially.
Each skill point increases the safe angle distance while dodging by 10 degrees.

Damage resistances
Damage dealt with a melee weapon increases Sign Power by $I$% (max $I$%). Resets after casting a sign and at the end of the combat.

Dealing melee damage to enemies increases your Attack Power by $S$% (max $S$%). Getting hit decreases the bonus proportional to damage received: $S$% per 1% of health lost. Resets at the end of the combat.

Dealing melee damage to enemies increases your Adrenaline Gain by $S$% (max $S$%). Getting hit decreases the bonus proportional to damage received: $S$% per 1% of health lost. Resets at the end of the combat.

Gain +$I$% to Attack Power, +$I$% to Sign Power, +$I$/s to Stamina regeneration and +$I$% to Adrenaline gain while your health is at $I$% or lower. Resets when you regain your health and at the end of the combat. $I$ sec cooldown.
Gain +$I$ to non-combat Vitality regeneration and +$I$ to combat Vitality regeneration. When your Stamina is at $I$% and below, gain another +$I$ to combat Vitality regeneration.
When you kill a foe, gain +$I$ to Vitality regeneration per each alive enemy nearby. Max bonus cannot exceed +$I$. Resets at the end of the combat.
When you kill a foe, gain +$I$ to combat Stamina regeneration per each alive enemy nearby. Max bonus cannot exceed +$I$. Resets at the end of the combat.
